books.author: by Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.
books.name: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The ninth book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series focuses on conflicts with Native Americans.
books.name: KILLING CRAZY HORSE

books.author: by Ted Cruz
books.description: The Republican senator from Texas gives his views on what might happen if liberals gain a simple majority on the Supreme Court.
books.name: ONE VOTE AWAY

books.author: by Wally Koval
books.description: Photographs and stories of more than 200 locations from around the world that are inspired by the aesthetic of the film director Wes Anderson.
books.name: ACCIDENTALLY WES ANDERSON

books.author: by Pete Souza
books.description: The former White House photographer juxtaposes pictures of former President Obama with tweets, headlines and quotes from the Trump administration.
books.name: SHADE

books.author: by Jerry Seinfeld
books.description: The comedian shares material he collected in an accordion folder over the last 45 years.
books.name: IS THIS ANYTHING?

books.author: by Bob Woodward
books.description: Based on 17 on-the-record interviews with President Trump and other reporting, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist details the president’s perspective on multiple crises.
books.name: RAGE

books.author: by Robert Lacey
books.description: A look at the potential factors that led to the divergent life paths of Prince William and Prince Harry.
books.name: BATTLE OF BROTHERS

books.author: by Candace Owens
books.description: The conservative commentator makes her case that Black Americans should part ways with the Democratic Party.
books.name: BLACKOUT

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by Fareed Zakaria
books.description: The CNN host posits what might happen on the other side of the Covid-19 pandemic.
books.name: TEN LESSONS FOR A POST-PANDEMIC WORLD

books.author: by Tom Fitton
books.description: The president of Judicial Watch gives his opinions on forces he sees as detrimental to the Trump presidency.
books.name: A REPUBLIC UNDER ASSAULT

books.author: by Peter Frampton with Alan Light
books.description: Key career moments are recounted by the musician inducted into the 2020 Grammy Hall of Fame for his album "Frampton Comes Alive!"
books.name: DO YOU FEEL LIKE I DO?
